</term> <term> <id>Sampler</id> <description>Refers to any kind of sampling device used to collect physical samples</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology</id> <description>Broad catagory of dive Biology samplers</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:ChimneyMaster</id> <description>A hydraulically actuated net used in hydrothermal vent investigations that is lined with mesh and suspended in an aluminum frame and is used to remove and collect all attached and associated fauna from the substrate along with a surface layer of loose rocks and sulfides.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:ColonizationSubstrate</id> <description>Substrate is deployed on seafloor to document time series colonization.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:CrabTrap</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:ExclusionCage</id> <description>A biological sampling device that is designed to selectively permit some organisms to settle in an area while prohibiting access to other organisms.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:FossilizationCage</id> <description>experimental device made out of titanium, which is deployed at smokers to look at the growth of sulfide chimneys of black smokers and the way different items such as shells or tubes or other material are fossilized</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:IncubationChamber</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:MOCNESS</id> <description>Multiple Opening/Closing Net and Environmental Sampling System</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:MusselPot</id> <description>Type of biological sampler designed to sample mussel beds and the associated community.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:Net</id> <description>A sampler that consists of fibers woven in a grid-like mesh to allow particles of smaller sizes to pass through the mesh while retaining larger particles.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:Pump</id> <description>A sampling device that uses moves fluids by physical or mechanical action to collect organisms.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:PushCore</id> <description>A small coring device held by the manipulator arm of a submersible</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:Scoop</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:VentCap</id> <description>An in-situ situ growth chamber used in hydrothermal vent studies.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Biology:WormWok</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid</id> <description>Broad category of Fluid samplers</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:Bottle</id> <description>A generic term used to describe a device used to recover a discrete water sample to the surface. Includes Niskin bottles.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:GasTight</id> <description>Gas Tight Fluid sampler used for collecting hydrothermal vent fluids. </description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:GasTight:IGT</id> <description>Isobaric Gas Tight  fluid sampler.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:Ghostbuster</id> <description>The Ghostbuster in situ chemical sampler designed by Kang Ding/Bill Seyfried of UMN</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:HFPS</id> <description>Hydrothermal Fluid and Particle Sampler</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:HFS</id> <description>Hydrothermal Fluid Sampler</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:HotFluid</id> <description>System consisting of pumps, valve, temperature probes, and various sensors -  carried by an ROV or manned-sub with an embedded interfacing controller program.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:Major</id> <description>Water sampler that use a syringe-like plunger to draw in vent fluids through a narrow titanium nozzle that is placed down into the throat of the vent. </description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:OsmoSampler</id> <description>In situ long-term continuous osmotic water sampler.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:Pump</id> <description>Used to collect discrete physical sample of fluid that is stored in a bag or bottle until recovered to the surface.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:RAS</id> <description>Water sampler designed to collect in-situ water samples over time.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:RAS-PPS</id> <description>Remote Access Sampler and Preserved Particle Sampler</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:Squeeze</id> <description>Geoff Wheat's squeeze sampler</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:SuPR</id> <description>Suspended Particulate Rosette (SuPR) collects tiny particles from plumes of hot fluids with the ability to analyze the chemical composition of those particles right at the seafloor.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Fluid:Toaster</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Manipulator</id> <description>Robotic arm used on submersibles for grabbing rocks, bio samples, etc.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Rock:Core</id> <description>Sampling device used to acquire rock samples, can also be referred to as a wax core. Typically a wax-coated ball that is dropped (from an ROV or towed system) into glassy basalt to collect a rock fragments.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Rock:Dredge</id> <description>A device with rectangular frame connected to a chain bag that is dragged along the seafloor to collect rock samples.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Rock:Drill</id> <description>Drill used to obtain a small core of rock, usually for land samples. Often, the drill and resultant rock core sample is oriented for later P-mag studies. </description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:BoxCore</id> <description>A square or rectangular sampling device used for retrieving samples from unconsolidated sediments. </description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:SedimentCore</id> <description>A cylindrical sampling device used to collect a section of a naturally occurring medium.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:GougeCore</id> <description>Similar to a Russian corer and also used to sample peaty soils. The long, open cylindrical coring chamber is pushed into the subsurface, twisted and recovered to capture an undisturbed sample of material.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:Grab</id> <description>A scoop-like device used to recover surface sediments from the seafloor</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:GravityCore</id> <description>A sediment sampling device, consisting of a weight with a long core tube, that is lowered to a designated height above the sea floor and then dropped and embedded into the sediment. </description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:JumboPistonCore</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:KastenCore</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:MultiCore</id> <description>A sediment sampling device with several tubes that are driven into the sediment by lead weights. The rate of decent is typically controlled by a hydraulic damper.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:PistonCore</id> <description>A sediment sampling device with a tube, weight, and trigger arm that is lowered to a height above the seafloor and then allowed to free-fall to the seafloor. The trigger arm provides extra force to penetrate more deeply into the sediment.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:RussianCore</id> <description>Used to sample peat and other woody plant material. The coring chamber is pushed into the subsurface using extension rods. When the target depth is reached, a T-handle is used to rotate the entire core assembly 180 degrees. In doing so, a sharp metal edge cuts longitudinally to capture an undisturbed sample of material. The corer is then pulled back up to recover the sample. </description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:Scoop</id> <description>Used to sample sediments - usually preserves a good sediment-water interface. </description> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:Slurp</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:SedimentTrap</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:TriggerCore</id> </term> <term> <id>Sampler:Sediment:VibraCore</id> <description>A device for collecting sediment cores that is driven into the sediment by a hydraulic, pneumatic, mechanical or electrical mechanism.</description> <term> <id>Seismic:Seismometer</id> <description>Measures ground motions generated by seismic sources including earthquakes and volcanic eruptions.</description> </term> <term> <id>Seismic:Sonobuoy</id> <description>Deployed buoy with hydrophone (s) ejected from ship (or aircraft). A radio transmitter relays acoustic information from hydrophone to ship.</description> </term> <term> <id>Seismic:Subbottom</id> <description>Images the shallow seafloor subsurface, eg. Knudsen, 3.5 kHz sonars. Note that 3.5 kHz echosounder can generate both subbottom data and seafloor depth data.</description> </term> <term> <id>Seismic:Subbottom:CHIRP</id> <description>Swept frequency subbottom profiler</description> </term> <term> <id>Sensor:MicrobialFuelCell</id> <description>A device that converts chemical energy to electrical energy by the catalytic reaction of microorganisms.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar</id> <description>An instrument that uses underwater sound propagation typically used to observe characteristics of the seafloor or water column, but also used to for underwater navigation.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:ADCP</id> <description>A sonar that is used to produce a record of water current velocities for a range of depths.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:ADV</id> <description>Instrument to measure water column instantaneous velocity components</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:Echosounder</id> <description>is a device which uses acoustic technology for the measurement of underwater physical and biological components.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:Interferometric</id> <description>With interferometric sonar systems, the acoustic energy is propagated from the transducer downward in a beam that is narrow in the along-track dimension and wide in the across-track dimension. This method produces a line of depth measurements across-track, i.e. perpendicular to the research vessel\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds trackline. As the vessel moves forward, these profiles sweep out a ribbon-shaped surface of depth measurement.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:InvertedEchoSounder</id> <description>An ocean bottom-moored instrument that measures vertical acoustic travel time round trip from the sea floor to the sea surface.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:LADCP</id> <description>An Acoustic Doppler Current Profiler typically installed on an  instrument platform lowered at the end of a hydrographic wire.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:Multibeam</id> <description>A sonar system that effectively creates a swath of sound beams typically used for bathymetric surveys.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:Scanning</id> <description>Single beam sonar with an articulating transducer which rotates through a preset angular range creating a slalom of bathymetric soundings along the survey track.</description> </term> <term> <id>Sonar:Sidescan</id> <description>A sonar device that emits fan-shaped pulses toward the seafloor across a wide angle perpendicular to the path of the sensor through the water, which may be towed from a surface vessel or submarine, or mounted on the ship's hull. The intensity of the acoustic reflections from the seafloor of this fan-shaped beam is recorded in a series of cross-track slices.</description> </term> <term> <id>SoundVelocitySensor</id> <description>A device that utilizes the Doppler effect to measure the speed of sound in water.</description> </term> <term> <id>Spectrometer:Gamma</id> </term> <term> <id>Spectrometer:Raman</id> </term> <term> <id>Spectrometer:XRF</id> <description>Used for elemental analysis</description> </term> <term> <id>ThermalBlanket</id> <description>Device for estimated seafloor heat flux in diffuse flow regions.</description> </term> <term> <id>ThermocoupleArray</id> </term> <term> <id>Thermosalinograph</id> <description>Thermosalinograph (TSG) is an automated Sea Surface Temperature and Salinity measurement system measured onboard using a water intake.</description> </term> <term> <id>Tiltmeter</id> <description>A device that uses a horizontal reference frame to determine tilt </description> </term> <term> <id>TraceChemicalSensor</id> </term> <term> <id>Transmissometer</id> <description>Measures fraction of light, from a collimated light source, reaching a light detector a set distance away.</description> </term> <term> <id>Transponder</id> <description>Transmits sound used for acoustic navigation</description> </term> <term> <id>TurbidityMeter</id> </term> <term> <id>WaterGun</id> <description>Type of seismic source</description> </term> <term> <id>WeatherStation</id> <description>Generic term to describe the suite of instruments used to monitor weather conditions</description> </term> </terms> </vocabulary>
